186035284.review: Honestly, the best game on Steam for playing boardgames

186034259.review: What Tabletop Simulator misses in the tactile fun of physical board games, it makes up for in accessibility. Between the virtual board gaming bridging long distances; the community support for this release letting you test board games and other tabletop experiences before you buy them; and the goofy fun of flinging meeples around; there's truly endless joy to be had in this Simulator.

185976501.review:
Przykro mi ale niestety jestem zmuszony dać opinie negatywną dla tej gry.

[b]1.[/b] Po pierwsze wchodząc do gry wita nas menu, które niestety wygląda co najmniej jakby zostało wykonane w Paincie z kilku bloczków. Totalny brak ładu oraz składu w tym. Nie wiadomo które ustawienia są do czego, do tego brak wsparcia dla chociażby języka Polskiego.

[b]2.[/b] Już dawno żadna gra mnie tak nie sfrustrowała już na starcie. Ładowanie assetów tutaj to jest po prostu żart. Albo się ładują albo prze 10 minut stoi w miejscu i myśli zamulając w tym czasie sprzęt. Brakuje Tabletopowi w tej kwestii dużej optymalizacji. Mapy często zajmują bardzo dużo a to odbija się potężnie na wydajności.

[b]3.[/b] [u]Samo założenie Tabletopa jest super i pod tym względem polecam każdemu ale... .[/u] Sprawy optymalizacyjne leżą tutaj całkowicie. Tak jak już mówiłem mapy często zajmują dużo miejsca, albo ładują się w nieskończoność zamulając sprzęt. Jeśli masz starszy sprzęt albo po prostu wolny procesor...to nie polecam. Szkoda nerwów wtedy i czasu.

185742280.review:
If you haven't had the pleasure to try this simulator of table top gaming out, then read through the rest of the reviews and determine that it is in fact, quite amazing. 

Sure, it has a clunky control system that you have to get used to. Indeed, it has a massive workshop of great games, and even some DLC that could be worth your hard earned credits of currency. 

I use it to prototype and play test games for the real world, which I find it to be invaluable for.  

* Even with my slow and horrid internet connection it still manages to keep connection to friends (who have their own copy of the game) while my network drops many packets. I have tried hosting the game with a sharecast of the game to the players, but personally due to network issues on my end, I find it best if they also have their own copy. FWIW. *

This simulator is well crafted, it runs smooth even on slower pc's; its fantastic! 

Don't let the negative reviews keep you from checking out one of the better (best?) tabletop gaming simulators. 

[b] It is well worth full price. [/b]

185676451.review:
Hello and welcome to a review of tabletop simulator , If you can't be bothered to read TLDR 3/10 . 

- the Good - 

1) Okayish modding scene . 

2) Quite a bit of moddability if you put in the efford to make something yourself . (There even is a discord server for the game where you can get help on how to mod this game)

- The Bad - 

1) All base game content is very limited and very generic . 

2) Most maps in the workshop are very low efford . 

3) Beyond just simulating some board games aka most of the time just move some card and or objects manually you can't do anything else (TBF its in the title) 

4) Scripting in general is very limited , even in the maps that bothered to script at all if you make a save and then reload it the scripts [b] instantly break [/b] . 

- the Ugly - 

1) Ui is very simplistic to the point that its bad but i do think there are people out there that would appreciate this . 

2) [b] EXTREMELY [/b] Group heavy . If you don't have a squad of at least 3 people or more then you won't be able to play like 90% of all the maps . 

3) Most maps (assuming that you have the amount of people it requires) generally have a whole bunch of pages with rules that at least one of you should memorize all of them . This isn't either good or bad .


- Conclusion -

Considering all of the above i really can't bring myself to rate this any more than a 3/10 for the price . I would only recommend you to buy this game if you are in either of these situations . 
1) are a huge fan of tabletop games in general And also have a couple of buddies to play with 

2) If you are looking to make your own maps for the game . (this includes me)
If you aren't in any of the above scenarios then i would recommended to skip this game .

185629428.review:
A very valuable resource to anyone into the Tabletop games format. The appeal boils down to the fact most of the content you consume in this game will be user generated, and has an open-backend with the ability to script/code features into the game, resulting in some truly impressive tables. Catan? Randomized maps. Monopoly? Pick 15 variations and enjoy. Pokemon fan? Check out Legend of Sinnoh (and use the QoL mods too with the Additive Load function!) or Let's Go Adventure; both hours long time sinks you and friends can enjoy.

There's only 3 downsides/negative things I can say about this game:
1: It will EAT through storage since it saves assets to your documents folder. just go Documents -> My Games ->Tabletop Simulator ->Mods and delete the Images, Images Raw, Models, and Models Raw folders to clear them up (I just recovered 51.4GB doing this lol. Granted that includes a table over 150mb itself)
2: The Scripting uses the Lua coding language; notoriously annoying to work with
3: Your enjoyment on the game will correlate to if you have people to play it with unless you're REALLY into single player board games like the Slay the Spire board game. I recommend only investing in this game if you know you have 3+ people to play with. Check out some of the public lobbies too; there's Red Dragon Inn games and similar open to the public that might help you find some new friends! Just beware of trolls, those exist too.

And with that, enjoy your time!

185387139.review:
Alright, so I’ve played 530 hours of Tabletop Simulator. No, that’s not a typo—530 hours. I’ve spent more time with this game than some people spend at work (don’t tell my boss). And you know what? I’m still not tired of it.

First things first: Tabletop Simulator is a digital miracle. I’ve been able to play a variety of classics, from Monopoly (we don't talk about that one) to Settlers of Catan, all the way to obscure, highly intellectual games like "Uno but with Extra Rules" (yes, that’s a real thing). The real joy is the endless variety in the Workshop. Want to play Twilight Struggle? Check. How about Risk... but with exploding dice? Check. An unholy mashup of Chess, Cards Against Humanity, and a trampoline? Yep, there’s a mod for that.

Sure, it may occasionally glitch out when you're trying to stack cards (in this universe, cards do not want to stack), or your friend inevitably flips the table during the game of Exploding Kittens (always a classic), but these are the endearing quirks of Tabletop Simulator.

The physics engine? It's a mess. And I love it. Need to knock over an entire stack of cards for no reason? You can do that. Want to send your pawn flying across the table as an "accident"? Perfect. The chaos is truly unparalleled. If you're looking for an extremely realistic simulation of throwing dice and pieces across your living room, you've come to the right place.

As for the community? Well, some Workshop mods are lovingly crafted, others... are less so (looking at you, Uno with gravity). But hey, it's all part of the fun. Plus, playing with random strangers means you get to practice your patience... and your ability to pretend you didn’t just spill an entire deck of cards by accident.

In conclusion, Tabletop Simulator is a perfect place for people who love board games and have no fear of chaos or broken friendships. It's a little clunky, a little glitchy, and often a lot of frustration, but in a fun way. And after 827 hours, I can confidently say: this is where I want to be. (Though I really should work on my actual social skills…)

Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m off to knock over another table. For science.

[h1]Ihr wohnt auf dem Land oder in einer Stadt wo ihr niemanden kennt, habt aber mega Lust mal wieder einen schönen Spieleabend mit Snacks und Freunden zu machen?[/h1]

Dann holt euch jetzt Tabletop  Simulator!
Eine Runde UNO? Check!
Ein bisschen Wut in Mensch Ärger dich nicht? Check!
Die Hommage an den Kapitalismus, Monopoli spielen? Check!

Und das alles ohne, dass ihr die einzelnen Spiele digital oder im Karton erwerben müsst!
ein einziges Mal 19,50€ für alle Brettspiele (insofern im Workshop) Das ist ein Kracher!

Das einzige was ihr braucht und nicht im Preis inklusive ist sind Freunde, aber mit Tabletop Simulator ist es egal wo diese sind! Du bist in Deutschland, dein bester Freund in der USA und deine Ehefrau in Japan? Kein Problem an dem Tisch in Tabletop Simulator findet ihr alle Platz!

Und wenn dir doch alles zu viel wird dann wirf einfach den ganzen Tisch um. Das was du schon immer mal IRL machen wolltest aber dein Anstand es dich nicht hat machen lassen. TU ES!

184896989.review:
[h2]Tabletop Simulator: рай для любителей настолок и кнопка для переворачивания стола! 🎲[/h2]

Представьте себе игру, где можно не только сыграть в шахматы, покер или маджонг, но и одним движением перевернуть весь стол, если проигрываете! Tabletop Simulator – это бесконечный мир настольных игр, доступных онлайн, и простор для вашей фантазии. Хотите создать свою игру, устроить эпическое RPG-приключение или проверить друзей на выдержку в карточной битве? Легко!

[h2]Почему стоит попробовать?[/h2]

✅Более 15 классических игр в базе, плюс тысячи пользовательских модов в Steam Workshop. Настольный арсенал впечатляет!
✅Подходит для всех: от бабушек, которые обожают домино, до тех, кто мечтает о DnD с эпическими подземельями.
✅Можете создавать свои игры, загружать 3D-модели, писать сценарии на Lua, а потом хвастаться перед друзьями.
✅В мастерской – тысячи настолок, которые не обязательно покупать: от шахмат до RPG-данджей, включая дорогущие игры, которые теперь можно попробовать за смешные деньги.
✅Наличие мастерской избавляет от надобности брать DLC. Базовой "коробки" хватит с головой.
✅Потрясающий инструмент для тех, у кого нет денег на дорогие настолки.
✅Физика такая, что чувствуешь себя за настоящим столом

[h2]Минусы? Ну, их немного:[/h2]
❗️Русского языка в интерфейсе и на карточках нет. Увы, "кто ходит следующий" всё ещё звучит по-английски.
❗️Не все игры сделаны идеально – некоторым модам не хватает доработки или локализации.

[h2]Итог:[/h2]
[b]Tabletop Simulator[/b] – это настоящая находка для тех, кто любит настолки и свободу выбора. Играй как хочешь, создавай что хочешь, и переворачивай стол, если всё пошло не так! 🙃

184762905.review:
Excelente, este jogo é obrigatório na biblioteca de qualquer entusiasta ou viciado no hobby de jogos de tabuleiro. Tem todo tipo de jogo que você imaginar, é excelente pra você testar jogos pra saber se gostou da gameplay e do estilo antes de ter certeza que quer comprar ele físico, fora que pra pessoas que moram longe ou não conseguem estar juntos naquele momento é muito bom pra jogar esses jogos que você só conseguiria jogar presencial. É ótimo pra inserir pessoas no hobby e já ensinar as regras antes, pra jogar jogos que estão out of print, tudo isso.
Mas com certeza a maior vantagem é poder testar qualquer jogo de tabuleiro possivel, jogar uma partida se apaixonar no jogo e ter certeza que quer gastar dinheiro nele porque jogos de tabuleiro no Brasil já não são baratos então melhor termos certeza de que queremos gastar aquela grana. Fora que é bom demais também pra quem não tem ou não quer gastar toda aquela grana nos jogos, pode jogar eles de boa por um preço unico e com a experiencia não tao afetada por não ser o jogo fisico, consegue ser divertido do mesmo jeito.

Joguei sessões de mansions of madness, pandemic, monstros e tesouros, reino de cthulhu, monopoly, amigos de m4rda, cthulhu death may die, nada te atrapalha a gameplay sera igual e da pra jogar até com remote play com quem não tem o jogo. 

Não tem nem o que dizer, tabletop simulator é uma das melhores criações dos jogos simuladores.

184345590.review: Great with friends, lots of board games to play. It had its highest value during lockdown but is also nice if you've some good friends you can't always see in person. Obviously there's clunkiness and if you have a favourite game you're better off playing a digital version of that game, but there's a lot of fun. It's also really good for if you're interested in a board game you might want to buy a physical version, but you want to give it a play first.

184324346.review:
My friend told me to buy this and at first I wasn't sure if I'd like it because it wouldn't give you the same feeling as normal boardgames do but damn was I wrong.

This is by far one of the most fun, hilarious and enjoyable games I've ever gotten and I can only recommend it to anybody who loves to have a chill evening with friends from all over the globe. There are thousands of free games available for download in the workshop. I do recommend having one active person in your friendgroup installing all of the games, it will make it a lot easier to swap inbetween them.

All in all, [b]100% RECOMMEND! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT![/b]

183883384.review:
A great game for anyone who likes to tabletop.
Unfortunately it relies on steam servers, but it's good enough that it's worth it imo.
I'd also point out that if you use a boot drive and a data drive it'd be a good idea to tell it to move your saves to your data drive as you'll need mods to make the most of it for rpgs. An SSD would be helpful too, but not required.

183856097.review:
Nem tudom eléggé dicsérni. Nagyon nagyon hasznos játék az olyanok számára akiknek már nem igazán van idejük kimozdulni, vagy nem tudnak egy jót társasozni a barátaikkal a távolság miatt.
Valamint többször használtuk barátaimmal, társasjáték tesztelésre.
A kezelése nem a legegyszerűbb néhol, de ha egy kicsit a mélyére néz az ember, azt is meg lehet tanulni.
A legjobb pedig az, hogy rengeteg ingyenes társasjáték van a workshopban, amit alapon lehet nem tudnék megvenni vagy pedig nem lenne időm kipróbálni másokkal.

183779098.review:
1047 hours at the time of this writing.  Can you dig it?

If you can imagine the power of a tabletop simulator may ought to be, Tabletop Simulator will largely match and exceed your imagination. 

It's not without its limitations.  But you can play pretty much anything on the tabletop thanks to the huge community of modders.  Mods are super easy to install with this softare.  

There's a learning curve, you bet.  You're learning how to use virtual hands with a mouse and keyboard (unless you're in VR, then you've got your own world of confoundments there to struggle with), it's going to take time to get right with all the hotkeys and interactables and curious tools.

But oh, the riches that await you once you cross that threshold.

If the above entices you, this is for you.  If the above does NOT entice you, don't buy this unless your friends ask you to.  It's likely, at some point, they will if they haven't already.
